page.title: 03SETTLEMENT
page.content: The area has been settled since about 3000 BC. In the SE corner of the block near Craighill on a high bluff overlooking the Fithie Burn is the site of an{IRON AGE FORT}and{BROCH.} The oldest historical settlement is the hill-foot village of Balgray/Tealing but only the Kirkton with its old church lies within the block. Some new bungalow-type houses are being built here. The newest settlement is{INVERALDIE} situated in the centre of the block close to the Forfar Road. During the last war the RAF built quarters for airmen here. The camp cinema is still used as a hall. After the war squatters from Dundee moved into the disused buildings. Then the local Council were forced to build modern flatted accommodation. Recently new semi-detached houses have been built.
